Posts.Content: Welcome from another new guy who feels your pain. I'm scheduled for the DaVinci on 5/31/17 myself. I've been through every possible feeling since I first saw my PSA went up. Just reading the posts calmed me. Good luck and may God guide your surgeon's hands.
Posts.Signature: PSA 1.3 8/2014 PSA 5.9 12/2016 63 yo Local Uro DRE 7 mm nodule Biopsy 2/2017 +6/12 cores Gleason 3 + 3 (5) Gleason 3 + 4 (1) Bulk of tumor is in Left Lobe at the base with extension to R lobe Bone scan negative MRI T3 scanner Tumor size 8x17x14mm lesion L lobe No capsule penetration, seminal vesicle invasion, pelvic adenopthy Prostate volume 27ml DaVinci Prostatectomy: 5/31/2017 Dr David Samadi ,Lennox Hill Hospital, NYC Pathology Initial pathology: upgraded to G7 All margins clear, no capsular penetration Best of all: No incontinence

Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer and Talcum Powder Connection? And one other subject.

Posts.Content: Hi, I am, unfortunately, new to this site but I was thinking about the same issue. As a physician myself I was completely shocked to discover I had prostate cancer. I read up on it and I do not have a single risk factor. In fact, quite the opposite. Even have been a vegetarian since I was 20. But, thanks to my mom, I have used baby powder since I was a kid. I like the smell and the dryness since I'm on my feet constantly. I guess I'm addicted to it Always used J & J Brand. No one really knows how it travels, since it hasn't been studied, but it could do so on a molecular level. So this is all speculation on my part. After all, it's human nature to try to blame someone/something for our problems when, in fact, it may well come down to fate. I wish you well and it's nice to be among some caring people who "get it."

Posts.Title: Hello to all

Posts.Content: Bad: I just went through it myself 13 days ago. Feeling great now. First few days were no fun for me but things got progressively better. Foley was pulled yesterday and surprisingly, I was and continue to be continent today. Did a lot of Kegels beforehand but maybe I just got lucky. Make sure you have oversized boxers and sweat pants for the bloating especially for you walks with the leg bag. When home, I found the big bag to be more convenient because you have to keep the bag below your bladder to drain and I was always concerned that when I rested on the sofa it wasn't low enough. I wish you well and will be waiting for you on the other side...
Posts.Signature: PSA 1.3 8/2014 PSA 5.9 12/2016 63 yo Local Uro DRE 7 mm nodule Biopsy 2/2017 +6/12 cores Gleason 3 + 3 (5) Gleason 3 + 4 (1) Bulk of tumor is in Left Lobe at the base with extension to R lobe Bone scan negative MRI T3 scanner Tumor size 8x17x14mm lesion L lobe No capsule penetration, seminal vesicle invasion, pelvic adenopthy Prostate volume 27ml DaVinci Prostatectomy: 5/31/2017 Dr David Samadi ,Lennox Hill Hospital, NYC Pathology Initial pathology: upgraded to G7 All margins clear, no capsular penetration Best of all: No incontinence

Posts.Title: Surgery on Wednesday

Posts.Content: Hello all, Although perhaps many of you have had these post-op, these is for those with upcoming surgery to make your life just a little easier dealing with that catheter. If you google the name you will find it for sale on a lot of websites for about $10. It's a sticky patch that is stuck to your upper thigh after surgery. The catheter is inserted into it and it's held stable. So any pull is going to be on the patch and not your penis (ouch). It also swivels so depending how you are sitting/lying it will direct the catheter in the right direction. It is waterproof and only comes off with alcohol upon catheter removal. Why not ask your doc if he uses it. If not ask him if he will and buy one. Or put it on after you get home to make your life easier. I had my foley in for 12 days. This little patchAttachment 869 made a big difference.
